definitions.definition: The act of reflecting or the state of being reflected .
The property of a propagated wave being thrown back from a surface (such as a mirror ).
Something, such as an image , that is reflected.
examples: The dog barked at his own reflection in the mirror.
After careful reflection , I have decided not to vote for that proposition.

definitions.definition: A representative manifestation or outcome of a condition , trend or trait .
examples: Our recent results are a reflection of the progress we've made as a team.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to make an implied criticism .
examples: It is a reflection on his character that he never came back to see them.

definitions.definition: The process or mechanism of determining the capabilities of an object at run-time .
The folding of a part; a fold.

main_definition: The act of reflecting or the state of being reflected .
secondary_definitions: The property of a propagated wave being thrown back from a surface (such as a mirror ).
Something, such as an image , that is reflected.
A representative manifestation or outcome of a condition , trend or trait .
( computing ) The process or mechanism of determining the capabilities of an object at run-time .
( anatomy ) The folding of a part; a fold.
